definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)/4th earthly branch: 5-7 a.m., 2nd solar month (6th March-4th April), year of the Rabbit/ancient Chinese compass point: 90° (east)/variant of 鉚|铆[mao3]/to exert one's strength
to answer the roll call at 卯時|卯时[mao3 shi2], i.e. between 5 and 7 am/fig. to put in a conventional appearance
5-7 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to go to work/to start work
7-9 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to send/to assign/to appoint/servants of an official/official messenger
official post/billet/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差事[chai1 shi5]
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
